description: Central nervous system infection requiring immediate treatment
critical_note: MENINGITIS IS A MEDICAL EMERGENCY - Higher doses required for CNS penetration

regimens.reasoning: Vancomycin for S. pneumoniae (including resistant), ceftriaxone for N. meningitidis and H. influenzae
regimens.note: HIGHER DOSES required: Ceftriaxone 2g q12h (not q24h), Vancomycin loading dose

regimens.reasoning: Cephalosporins safe for mild PCN allergy, critical for meningitis
Vancomycin + respiratory fluoroquinolone for severe allergy
regimens.note: Consult ID - meningitis with severe PCN allergy is complex

regimens.reasoning: Vancomycin for S. epidermidis/aureus, cefepime for Pseudomonas

special_considerations.lumbar_puncture: Obtain before antibiotics if safe; do NOT delay antibiotics if LP delayed
special_considerations.monitoring: Serial LPs may be needed in post-surgical cases

pregnancy_considerations.notes: Most beta-lactams safe. Avoid fluoroquinolones. Consult MFM.
